title: Robert Perroud 2015 Romain En Saburin  (Brouilly)
description: Derived from the location of the vineyard in Saburin, this wine's name also reminds us that the Romans were here. The wine is well structured and rich. With 12 months in wood, it conveys spice as well as generous fruit, warm tannins and final acidity. Drink this wine now.

title: Sanguis 2014 Misfit Syrah (Central Coast)
description: Black currant, plum skins and roasted pork aromas show on the nose of this Syrah that's enhanced by Grenache, Petite Sirah, Viognier and Roussanne. Char siu flavors meet with lilacs, violets, charred beef and roasted plums on the palate.

title: Santa Barbara Winery 2014 Reserve Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Veteran winemaker Bruce McGuire packs telltale freshness in every bottling, and this reserve is no different, with buoyant aromas of black currant, crushed violets and black licorice. The palate's snappy blackberry flavors are cut by hints of anise, bay leaf and dill, with plenty of purple-flower lift.

title: Schloss Gobelsburg 2016 Ried Lamm Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: Utterly fresh hints of green Conference pear play on the nose of this wine. They also dominate the palate at first, before a salty, moreish touch of yeastiness leaves its textured imprint. All is united by bright, lemony freshness that has a savory tang.

title: Sileni 2015 Plateau Reserve Pinot Noir (Hawke's Bay)
description: Rich, heady notes of cola, charred meat, currant, earth and stones are followed by a silky, peppery palate with more currant notes and an earthy core. Perfect for fire side sipping, and at a great price to boot.

title: Sol Rouge 2013 Cabernet Franc (Red Hills Lake County)
description: This rich and layered wine has deep fruit flavors, a wonderful spiciness, firm structure and a lingering finish. It tastes like black olives, black cherries, cloves and wood smoke and has a wonderful, rounded mouthfeel backed by soft tannins.

title: The Drift 2015 There Are Still Mysteries Pinot Noir (Overberg)
description: This is a stunning wine that highlights the beauty and complexity to be found from a South African Pinot Noir. Minty fynbos and forest notes greet the nose upon first whiff, followed by a core of rich cherry and currant tones that are dusted by earth and cola spice. A subtle umami-like, wild-mushroom accent lends additional depth. The medium-weight palate boasts a satiny texture that's full of ripe fruit expression, yet not overdone. The long, evolving finish transitions seamlessly from fleshy berry to cherry skin then earth and bark before landing on a note of lightly toasted oak. Well balanced and complete, this is delicious now but should cellar and develop well through 2026.

title: Thirty-Seven Wines 2014 Grenache (Sonoma Coast)
description: This affordable red is high-toned in strawberry and a juicy earthiness, its use of oak and moderate power well-integrated. Smooth and velvety on the palate, it finishes in a bright tease of red licorice.

title: Topa Mountain Winery 2014 John Sebastiano Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: From a vineyard on the eastern edge of the Sta. Rita Hills, this bottling shows candied boysenberry, mocha, cherry compote, star anise and cinnamon on the nose. The palate is layered with tons of spice, from star anise and clove to licorice, which add depth to the black cherry base. The tannins are soft and polished.

title: Topa Mountain Winery 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This bottling from a new winery in Ojai shows salty lemons and lush nectarine on the nose alongside a touch of chives and roasted chicken flesh. The palate deftly blends browned butter with crisp citrusy freshness and a strong textural grip, proving refreshing and rich at the same time. The finish is chalky with hints of sea salt caramel and sliced apple.

title: Trinity Hill 2015 Pinot Noir (Hawke's Bay)
description: This is a complex and compelling wine from one of Hawkes Bay's top producers. Cherry and orange notes mingle with black olive, cracked pepper, smoke and cumin. These lead into a medium body, with balanced acidity and silky tannins. Drink with a wide variety of Middle Eastern cuisine.

title: Wieninger 2016 Bisamberg White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)
description: This wine's nose is still a little closed, but the palate shows a zesty freshness that features fresh lemon, summer blossom and white currant tartness. It's light in body, with a slightly pithy texture that underlines the refreshing element even more. The finish is tangy and very refreshing.

title: Château de Saint-Cosme 2014  Condrieu
description: Invigorating freshness sets this impeccably balanced Viognier apart in a flight of peers. Crisp yellow peach, mango and orange flavors are pristine and cutting, accented by subtle vanilla, spice and marshmallow. It's primary and fruity without restraint, yet elegantly composed in heft and body.

title: Bokisch 2014 Tempranillo (Lodi)
description: There's no reason to drink Cabernet all the time when delicious, well-balanced and firm-textured California Tempranillos like this are becoming more and more common. From a specialist in Iberian grape varieties, the wine has lightly spicy aromas, nicely layered red- and black-cherry and wood-smoke flavors that fill the mouth and linger on the finish.

title: Domaine de la Royère 2015 Quercus Red (Luberon)
description: Heady layers of anise, vanilla and dark chocolate lend a seductive tone to this opulent red. Fleshy black-plum and blackberry flavors are mouthcoating and plump but offset neatly by brisk acidity and sharper edges of pepper and spice. Fine-grained but persistent tannins mark a long finish.

title: Domaine de Nalys 2014 Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Generous and broad, this plush wine offers lavish layers of strawberry and red-cherry preserves nuanced by more savory hints of earth, nuts and garrigue. It's rich and fleshy in texture with fine, soft tannins that extend the finish.

title: Craggy Range 2015 Le Sol Gimblett Gravels Syrah (Hawke's Bay)
description: An impenetrable, teeth-staining purple, the 2015 Le Sol is calling out for a cozy sweater and a fireplace. Intense woodsy aromas of cedar, pine needles, blackberry jam, medicinal herbs and smoky undertones lead into a palate that's herbal, juicy-fruited and framed by powerful, chewy tannins. The oak is on show at the moment but will settle with time. Drink now–2027.

title: Domaine Lathuilière Gravallon 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)
description: This structured wine has oak aging and old vines to thank for its density and ripe concentration. Its power and dark character will let it ripen well. Full of fruit and acidity, it has aging potential. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaines Dominique Piron 2016 Piron et Lameloise Quartz  (Chénas)
description: This is a rich, full wine, given structure both by wood aging and fruit tannins. Weight, density and good acidity are coming together in an harmonious whole. From 60-year-old vines, it will be ready from late 2018.

title: Domaines Laurent Perrachon & Fils 2016 Roche Bleue  (Juliénas)
description: With vineyards in the family since 1877, this producer offers a good range of wines, of which this is an excellent example. It is fruity, firm and seriously structured with juicy black fruit and acidity allied to a solid tannic base. Drink this ageworthy wine from 2019.

title: Errazuriz 2014 Don Maximiano Founder's Reserve Red (Aconcagua Valley)
description: Complex elegant aromas of sandalwood, spiced candle, blackberry and chocolate set the stage for an alert snappy palate with acidic and tannic clamp. Plenty of oak and related vanilla and spice flavors accent crisp jumpy red-fruit notes prior to a firm long finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Fattoria La Ripa 2010 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: This opens with aromas of iris, black-skinned berry, truffle and leather. Made with 90% Sangiovese and 10% Canaiolo, the juicy, balanced palate delivers fleshy black cherry, black pepper, pipe tobacco and a touch of balsamic herb alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2027.

title: Felsner 2016 Alte Reben Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)
description: This wine's intense, creamy, pear-laden nose leads to a textured palate full of yeast and miso-like savoriness. Citrus pith notes and bright lemon freshness only add to the mouthfeel. The finish is lip-smacking and savory.

title: Foley 2015 Barrel Select Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Smoked pork, dark soil, forest floor, purple flowers and dark-purple fruit show on the nose of this bottling. Rust and dried hibiscus petals are evident on the sip along with potpourri-laced cranberry and carnation flavors. It is quite complex and tasty.

title: François Lurton 2014 Hacienda Aurcano Alka Organic Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
description: Alka typically delivers size and oak, and this vintage shows a thick coating of oak on top of herbal cassis and blackberry scents. A concentrated, lively palate is bright in acidity, while oaky, savory flavors of balsamic berry fruits and chocolate finish baked, spicy, bold and chewy. Drink through 2023.

title: Gary Farrell 2015 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: Salty and floral, this wine offers deft layers of green apple, peach and pineapple—its richness subdued and in check—rounded by a bouquet of freshness that persists from start to finish. There's texture and complexity within nuance and restraint.

title: Heinrich Hartl 2016 Rotgipfler (Thermenregion)
description: Aromatic, ripe red apple and melon notes appear first on the nose but are underpinned by a savory streak of salty yeast. The palate brings the yeastiness to the fore, giving a lovely creamy texture. The finish is fresh but mellow.

title: Heritance 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Soft and fleshy, this is a nicely made, well-structured wine, dusty in black currant, clove and cedar notes, showing plenty of varietal character. Billowy tannins surround secondary flavors of black cherry and tobacco which add to its muted power and grace.

title: Josef Bauer 2016 Ried Rosenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)
description: This wine's abundant yellow pear notes suggest rounded ripeness on the nose. The palate comes in with a creamy, textured mouthfeel and salty, spicy nuances. It's concentrated, round and rich but remains toned and dry. Lovely.

title: Lucien Lardy 2016 Les Roches  (Fleurie)
description: This structured wine offers complex layers of tannins. Black fruits are very present, still young and developing, making for a wine that is dense, rich and needs time. Drink from 2019.
